attributes.description: Operational pressure range for optimal fluid distribution tailored to variable flight altitudes and temperatures.
attributes.name: operationalPressure

attributes.description: Precision specification ensuring that fluid flow is maintained within ±5% accuracy to optimize de-icing and anti-icing measures.
attributes.name: flowAccuracy

attributes.description: High-strength and lightweight titanium alloy used to ensure long-term durability and corrosion resistance in harsh environments.
attributes.name: materialSpecification

attributes.description: Triple redundant circuits implemented to ensure uninterrupted fluid distribution even during partial system failures.
attributes.name: redundantCircuits

attributes.description: Compliance with FAA, EASA, and ICAO certification standards ensuring adherence to all international aviation safety protocols.
attributes.name: certificationStandard

designScenario.description: The Fluid Distribution System is designed to manage and regulate the delivery of critical fluids across aircraft surfaces for de-icing and anti-icing applications. This system leverages smart pump assemblies, electronically-controlled valve arrays, and a comprehensive sensor feedback network to ensure real-time monitoring and adjustments. Safety, redundancy, and maintenance efficiency are prioritized, allowing for reliable operation under diverse environmental conditions and operational scenarios.
designScenario.name: Fluid Distribution System

details.description: The system shall dynamically modulate pump and valve operations based on real-time sensor input to maintain optimal fluid distribution during critical de-icing events.
The system must maintain specified operational pressures between 3-6 bar and ensure flow accuracy within ±5% to meet rapid fluid deployment needs.
Triple redundant circuits and fail-safe electronic controls must be implemented to guarantee system functionality even in the event of component failures.
The design must facilitate quick and safe maintenance procedures through the use of modular components and standardized connection interfaces.

relationships.description: The Fluid Distribution Unit includes the Smart Pump Assembly as a core component for managing variable fluid pressurization.
The Fluid Distribution Unit integrates the Electronic Valve Array to exert fine control over fluid delivery rates.
The Control Interface Module aggregates sensor feedback and commands operations of both the pump and valve assemblies.
The Sensor and Feedback Network comprises the Pressure Sensor Array, providing essential pressure data throughout the system.
The Sensor and Feedback Network comprises the Flow Meter, which measures real-time fluid flow rates.
The Control Interface Module depends on data from the Sensor and Feedback Network for real-time adjustments and safety overrides.

systemComponents.description: Core module that integrates all fluid control elements responsible for managing real-time distribution of fluids.
systemComponents.name: Fluid Distribution Unit

subComponents.description: Pump unit designed for variable flow and pressure management with integrated smart sensors and control mechanisms.
subComponents.name: Smart Pump Assembly

subComponents.description: Array of electronically controlled valves that modulate fluid release in response to system commands.
subComponents.name: Electronic Valve Array

subComponents.description: Digital control unit that processes sensor inputs and orchestrates pump and valve actions for optimal fluid management.
subComponents.name: Control Interface Module

systemComponents.description: Monitoring subsystem that provides real-time data for fluid pressure, flow, and temperature to support system adjustments and safety protocols.
systemComponents.name: Sensor and Feedback Network

subComponents.description: Sensors that accurately measure pressure variations to ensure operation within the designated 3-6 bar range.
subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Instrumentation that quantifies the volumetric flow rate, ensuring adherence to performance parameters.
subComponents.name: Flow Meter

comments.body: This block represents the subsystem responsible for distributing power within the airplane.
